favourite.article: This song just came to me right in my office and it brought tears to my eyes with a calming effect. Needed to know every word of it. Glad I found it here.

I am to deliver a talk in chapel this morning. The Lord woke me up past 2 am. As I was writing songs to talk about, I dosed off and woke up singing this one 'Great is the Lord. Psalm 48:1-2. I browse to know more, and I found this site. Great is the Lord...'It's one of the most popular worship song in Nigeria! Others include; there is none Holy as the Lord... By Hanna 1 Sam 2:2, Thou art worthy O Lord Rev. 4:11...by 24 elders, Be blessed as you praise Him today!

I had a dream and saw the mighty house of God being constructed in the dream. The house was so great and beautiful that I started singing this song. I had to wake up to see if I can get the song and the place it is in the Bible so that I can always read it to remember this dream. God is great.

I sang this hymn all night, woke up and continued..it, sang it all through may way to this office through a thick Lagos traffic, Had to google it for the correct lyrics ...bless God I am here...., This is an amazing song, Zion is in the north side of King David's palace...I must be in Yerusalem someday ..Great God, Great song, Great King, God bless Yisrael...

I learnt this song from my Parents while growing up in Northern Nigeria. My Dad really loves this song and the picture of my Dad singing this song during Family devotions keeps coming to mind as I sing this song. #GreatIsTheLord
I learned this scripture song as a praise song in Northern California in the mid 1970's. So glad to find it again.

Thanks for this site, I learnt this song in Malaysia when I became a born again Christian, I was 16 then. Married to a Godly Belgian man , living now in Belgium, Yes, it is Psalm 48.1 & 2, it brings back lovely memories, greatly blessed.
Praise God that this hymn writer understands the importance of Zion to God, the center of the earth, the pinnacle of His kingdom to come here. The city of the only true King, Jesus.
Truly the Lord is greatly to be praised.
Beautiful for situation, the joy of the whole earth...
Lord make us Zion.
Great is our Lord!!
HallelluJ:):)h:):)
Next Year in Yerusalem
I recalled this song recently. It makes me think of our eternal hope in God and His coming kingdom. Thank you.
Holy Spirit brought this to my spirit the other day. Have not heard this in years. I thank God and you.
Thanks for the correct lyrics. My family can sing it correctly.
Thanks. I now know the correct lyrics. God bless.

May I forget my right arm if I forget you, Oh true swim. I am on my first visit to Israel at the Sea of Galilee preparing to go to Jerusalem today and this song has been in my mind. We have not sang it in church for one or two decades but I still remember the words and the melody. I was blessed to find it on this site
I knew the man who wrote this song. His name was Robert Ewing from Waco TX. The lyrics should be "beautiful for situation" just like the scripture says! Not "elevation".

Many thanks for this site. It helped me learn the correct lyrics. I did not know that it was beautiful in elevation, I used to sing beautiful for all situations. This song really blesses my heart. God bless you huge.
Read the psalm and wanted to hear this song. Thank you.
Praise to the Lord!
Thank you for having this website. This song was ringing in my spirt 5 o'clock this morning and to have the music with the lyrics just exuded my spirit with abundant joy.

One of my favorite songs from sunday school. However we also sang it with a bridge which doesn't seem to be included here. Anyway the words are as follows if anyone is interested along with chords in Fmajor.
(F) One body, (Bflat/Asharp) One spirit, (F) One faith, (C7) One Lord, (F) One people, (Bflat/Asharp) One nation, (F) praise (C7)ye the (F)Lord…..
Each note is played in common time with the exception of "Praise ye the Lord" which is played…… (F) 2 beats….. (C7) 2 beats…..(F) 4 beats

i woke up this morning and heard "proclaim what I believe". I am working on a Christmas float with maybe a little procrastination due to cold weather and somthing holding me down. Today I feel great and plan on finishing. I don't know how why I happen on this site but am blessed by this site. I am looking for a very special song that pertains to 1 Cor. 15:3-4. This gospel must be proclaimed.
This song brings down the presence of God to my heart........
Reading the comments from the saints in Nigeria blesses me.
This made my day, Amen.
Thank you for posting this song online, the Lord brought it to my heart to sing today and I was so happy to find it on your site with lyric and music to sing along. God Yahweh Bless you!
The Lord is worthy to be praised. You are worthy, O Lord.

Thank you for the song lyrics. I have been looking everywhere and couldn't find it but now I did. I have been trying to find the lyrics because this morning I read Psalms 48 and I remembered this song. God Bless You all.

Hello Ms Doris, as I read your story, there is one thing I would like to share with you. You are somebody special in the eyes of the Lord, and He is more than able to perform great wonders in your life, at one condition: trust, believe and rely on Him 100%. Stop looking at your problem, instead look upon the Lord, and while you trust Him, have that picture of the thing that you want (a daughter who delights in her mother and who demonstrates the virtues of a Christian) and start praising the Lord for that. Have faith, and stop looking on circumstances. If God doesn't recognize something, don't recognize it either. Rejoice in the Lord, the One who is able to do exceedingly, abundantly above, all we can dare ask or think of, according to the power that works within us. Make bold declaration, confess with your mouth that your daughter is in the right path, even if visibly she isn't, but remember the fig tree didn't dry up that day when Jesus spoke, and yet He had already spoken. Get the picture of what you want, speak that very thing, and you shall see it happen. You are abundantly and greatly blessed.

Hello Cheryl.. you have given me so much hope.. Praise God.. I forget that I have commented on the bad experience, I had, while visitng my daughter; and just now found it, looking for a hymn in my favorites. God surely led me to your letter. I "out of the blue" brought it up! but, Praise God, I do have my son and my younger daughter back in mine with her life again! They have had bad experinces with her also; and; they have accepted me back again after 3 years, after I stayed away from the older daughter. I don't like to be partial though; and I am a very forgiving person. They need to forgive also. Please pray for them... And... God is continuing to heal the wounds.. I Praise God for your comforting comment! Love in Christ...

Ms Doris, Praise God, He is caring for you as you go through this trial! Continue to pray. The Lord is not through with you or your daughter. And we knot that ALL things work together for the good of those that love God, to those who are called according to HIS purpose. Because those whom He foreknew, He also predestinated us to be conformed to the image of His Son (Romans 8:28-29a). This situation with your daughter is part of yours and her divine transformation process. Praise the Lord! We serve a God who is faithful and just. Be confident in this very thing, that He who has begun in you will complete it until the day of Christ Jesus (Philippians 1:6) Be encouraged, sister.

When I think of His love to me I am speechless. Sometimes I wonder what have I done to deserve such great love. Despite the fact that I am a sinner but He love me anyway. Lord Jesus thank You so much. May Your name be glorified and exalted forever, Amen.

I play this beautiful hymn on my piano; and sing along with it.. I couldn't remember the words of the 3rd. line.. but; I got on the internet; and Praise God, here it is.. I have gone through so much hurt.. My daughter pushed me down and I fell to the floor; and beginning to kick me.. but, thank God, He was with me; and still is.. I made it back home (driving 450 miles) with my 13 year old cat.. to my home in San Diego County.. God was with me; and I got home safely! Please pray for me.. she still is harrassing me; with her lies.. but, thank God, without Him, I couldn't make it.. That life she lives is not for me; and she wasn't raised this way.. something has changed in her.. I believe it could be her boyfriend.. she committed her life to the Lord 30 years ago; and he doesn't know the Lord.. so please remember them both in prayer. I believe the Lord revealed to me, not to make the move up to where she lives.. I drove up there to look; and it is not for me.. I don't approve of the lifestyle.. I have lived here in my town for 58 years; and I just praise God that He has shown me what I needed to know.. I'm 80 years old; and with Him, I could not make it.. It is very hurting to know she did this, I would say for no reason.. But, I do feel strongly; and after much prayer, she wanted me up there to move in with me, with her live in boyfriend; and take over my finances.. Please pray for her (she is 59 yrs. old); and she has had to had "snapped".. I pray that she will get help.. Please pray that she will stop her lies; and continue to give me peace; and that my grandchildren will become to know the truth.. But, she is their mother; and God will someday reveal to them the truth.. but, I feel they already know.. Thank You so much! In His Name.. Praise God!! Doris p.s. I failed to add that this beautiful hymn is bringing me peace; and now, I know the exact words, I can continue to play it on my piano and sing along with it.. I knew it was in the book of Psalms somewhere; but couldn't find it.. Thanks so much!

The author of this beautiful song was known more for his ministry as a teacher and apostle in the Body of Christ. He had a great revelation of the scriptures and now we enjoy his legacy. Thank You, Lord for the gift you gave to us in Brother Robert Ewing!!
The Lord is great and worthy to be praised. Worship him in practice.
I love the LORD GOD ALMIGHTY. He is worthy to be praised. He is my heart, my soul and my mind. He is everything to me!
I've always loved this song. Thank you for the lyrics.
Thanks for helping me remember the good old days back when I was at a Catholic boarding school in Nigeria and we used to live on this song. The Lord is really Great.
Thank you! Good to hear this again. We used to sing it as part of outreach. Beautiful to sing Scripture.
This song has inspired me because I read this Psalm 48 for my devotion time today, i has kept me in praise of God for the whole day.
I really like this song, its familiar to me i hope i could have a copy for this song.
So great our Lord is, He is so worthy of our praises. Our God is great!!!
I like this song because it's short and I can memorize it and it says that The Lord is Great! I love to sing it with my Mom. Praise The Lord!
